bill_title: revise certain provisions concerning the hiring by school districts of persons convicted of felony drug distribution.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions concerning the hiring by school districts of persons convicted of felony drug distribution. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-10-13 be amended to read as follows: 13-10-13. A school district may refuse to employ a person, either directly or by contract, who has been convicted of a crime involving moral turpitude as defined in subdivision 22-1- 2(25). No person may be employed by a school district, either directly or by contract, if the person has been convicted of a crime of violence as defined in subdivision 22-1-2(9), or a sex offense , as defined in § 22-22-30 , or trafficking in narcotics . Nothing in this section prohibits a school district from considering any criminal conviction in making a hiring decision. Section 2. That chapter 13-10 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No person may be employed by a school district, either directly or by contract, if the person has been convicted of felony distribution of drugs. However, the prohibition provided for in this section does not apply if: (1) The person has been pardoned pursuant to chapter 24-13; or (2) Five years have elapsed since the person was released from custody and the person has not subsequently been convicted of a crime involving moral turpitude, as defined in subdivision 22-1-2(5).
